page.title: 06Recreating the "Vistas".
page.content: Work at{Studley Royal Park}by{The {National Trust}has started and one of the major jobs will be to open up the carefully "stage-managed" views that the park has to offer. The views , or {"vistas"}as they are called, provide the visitor with the chance to see the variety of man-made features within the park. These include statues, mock temples and other fascinating buildings. Through the passage of time, the "vistas" have closed up as the avenues of hedges and trees have grown together. Some of the{Yew}hedges by the canalised River Skell have been cut back to their original thickness. The original landscaping records have provided such distances away from the riverbank. In this particular example, the hedges were cut back some four to five metres.
